member.name: T:IDRSNET.IAdvancedBinarizeCallback
member.summary: The CAdvancedBinarizeCallback class is the base class to provide a callback class to the CAdvancedBinarize class' methods. Inheriting this class allows the integrator to define a custom algorithm for image binarization. \ingroup module_prepro_adv \req IDRS::IDRS_MODULE_PREPRO with extension IDRS::IDRS_PREPRO_EXTENSION_ADVANCED_PREPRO for information about the preprocessing library for information about advanced preprocessing extension for the binarization algorithms.

member.name: M:IDRSNET.IAdvancedBinarizeCallback.RemovePixel(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Dropout callback method called at the end of the binarization for each black pixel. The black pixel is transformed to white if the function returns IDRS_TRUE.
member.param: The red component of the pixel's color.
The green component of the pixel's color.
The blue component of the pixel's color.
member.returns: IDRS_TRUE If the black pixel must be transformed to white.
IDRS_FALSE otherwise.

member.name: T:IDRSNET.IAdvancedDespeckleCallback
member.summary: The CAdvancedDespeckleCallback class is the base class to provide a callback class to the CAdvancedDespeckle class'methods. \ingroup module_prepro_adv Inheriting this class allows the integrator to define a custom algorithm for speckle removing. \req IDRS::IDRS_MODULE_PREPRO with extension IDRS::IDRS_PREPRO_EXTENSION_ADVANCED_PREPRO for information about the preprocessing library for information about advanced preprocessing extension for the despeckle algorithm.

member.name: M:IDRSNET.IAdvancedDespeckleCallback.RemoveBlobTest(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: RemoveBlobTest is a callback method called by CAdvancedDespeckle before removing a group of connected pixels.
member.param: The height of the group of connected pixels.
The width of the group of connected pixels.
The number of black pixels in the group.
member.returns: IDRS_TRUE If the group of connected pixels must be removed.
IDRS_FALSE otherwise.

member.name: T:IDRSNET.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER
member.summary: Enumerable containing all barcode session parameters These parameters are used to control the behavior of the barcode engines

member.name: F:IDRSNET.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER_GLOBAL_PROCESSING
member.summary: Enables barcode global processing. Possible values are: - IDRS_TRUE: enables the setting - IDRS_FALSE: disables the setting

member.name: F:IDRSNET.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER_WORK_DEPTH
member.summary: Sets the barcode engine work depth. A lower value means that the engine should return the result(s) fast, while a higher value allows the engine to spend more time searching for barcodes. Expected range of values: [0 - 100]

member.name: F:IDRSNET.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER_MIN_HEIGHT
member.summary: Sets the minimum height for a barcode to be taken into consideration. Values are in pixels

member.name: F:IDRSNET.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER_MAX_HEIGHT
member.summary: Sets the maximum height for a barcode to be taken into consideration. Values are in pixels

member.name: F:IDRSNET.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER_MIN_LENGTH
member.summary: Sets the minimum solution length (character count) for a barcode to be taken into consideration.

member.name: F:IDRSNET.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER_MAX_LENGTH
member.summary: Sets the maximum solution length (character count) for a barcode to be taken into consideration.

member.name: F:IDRSNET.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER_DETECT_SLANTED_BARCODES
member.summary: Enables detection of slanted barcodes Possible values are: - IDRS_TRUE: enables the setting - IDRS_FALSE: disables the setting

member.name: F:IDRSNET.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER_RECOGNITION_DIRECTION
member.summary: Sets the barcode direction that could be used for detection. The available directions are found in - IDRS_BARCODE_LEFT_RIGHT (0x01) - IDRS_BARCODE_RIGHT_LEFT (0x02) - IDRS_BARCODE_TOP_BOTTOM (0x04) - IDRS_BARCODE_BOTTOM_TOP (0x08) - IDRS_BARCODE_DIRECTION_ANY (0x0F) The value provided with this parameter is a bitmask combination of the available directions. When provided with a value that is different than IDRS_BARCODE_DIRECTION_ANY, the barcode engine is expected to disregard the barcode solutions for which the reading is different than the one requested

member.name: F:IDRSNET.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER_RECOGNITION_MODE
member.summary: Sets the barcode recognition mode that needs to be used for detection. The possible values are described in - IDRS_BARCODE_RECOGNITION_MODE_STOP_ON_FIRST_RESULT - IDRS_BARCODE_RECOGNITION_MODE_READ_ALL_BARCODES

member.name: F:IDRSNET.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_TIMEOUT_MILLISECONDS
member.summary: Sets the timeout in milliseconds after which the engine should stop doing recognition

member.name: F:IDRSNET.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER_CODE128_CONTROL_CODE
member.summary: Enables barcode code128 control code mode. Possible values are: - IDRS_TRUE: enables the setting - IDRS_FALSE: disables the setting

member.name: F:IDRSNET.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER_AUTOMATIC_ENCODING_DETECTION_UTF8
member.summary: Enables automatic utf8 encoding detection. Possible values are: - IDRS_TRUE: enables the automatic detection - IDRS_FALSE: disables the automatic detection

member.name: F:IDRSNET.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER_AUTOMATIC_ENCODING_DETECTION_SJIS
member.summary: Enables automatic SJIS encoding detection. Possible values are: - IDRS_TRUE: enables the automatic detection - IDRS_FALSE: disables the automatic detection

member.name: F:IDRSNET.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER.IDRS_BARCODE_SESSION_PARAMETER_MAX
member.summary: ! Internal value.

member.name: T:IDRSNET.IBarcodeEngine
member.summary: CBarcodeEngine represents the base class for the barcode engines used by iDRS SDK This class needs to be extended when creating a new barcode engine that would be used with iDRS SDK. A typical barcode engine is expected to have: - session based recognition - a set of barcodes that it can recognize. - a set of capabilities - a unique identifier which will be used to target the specific barcode engine. Please use a value larger than 100.

member.name: M:IDRSNET.IBarcodeEngine.GetBarcodeEngineUniqueIdentifier
member.summary: GetBarcodeEngineUniqueIdentifier retrieves barcode unique identifier. The value retrieved by this function will be used to reference this barcode engine when setting different properties as well as in results. Please use values larger than 100 when creating new barcode engines registered with iDRS SDK. Currently iDRS SDK uses values 0 to 7, but future versions might include new engines.
member.returns: Unique identifier for the barcode engine

member.name: M:IDRSNET.IBarcodeEngine.GetCapabilitiesCount
member.summary: GetCapabilitiesCount retrieves the number of capabilities supported by the barcode engine. For a list of available capabilities, please consult
member.returns: Number of capabilities supported by the barcode engine

member.name: M:IDRSNET.IBarcodeEngine.HasCapability(IDRSNET.IDRS_BARCODE_CAPABILITY)
member.summary: HasCapability verifies if the barcode engine supports a certain capability
member.param: Capability value
member.returns: IDRS_TRUE if the capability is supported, IDRS_FALSE otherwise

member.name: M:IDRSNET.IBarcodeEngine.GetSupportedCapabilities(IDRSNET.IDRS_BARCODE_CAPABILITY[],System.UInt32)
member.summary: GetSupportedCapabilities retrieves the list with supported capabilities
member.param: Preallocated array that the engine is expected to fill with the capabilities information
Number of elements in the array
member.returns: IDRS_SUCCESS if all supported capabilities can be retrieved. Error code otherwise

member.name: M:IDRSNET.IBarcodeEngine.GetSupportedBarcodeTypesCount
member.summary: GetSupportedBarcodeTypesCount retrieves the number of barcode types in that the engine can recognize. If the new engine can detect barcode types that are not in the IDRS_BARCODE_TYPE enum, iDRS SDK considers it as custom barcode type. For these type of barcodes, please use GetSupportedCustomBarcodeTypesCount, GetSupportedCustomBarcodeTypes and IsCustomBarcodeTypeSupported methods
member.returns: Number of barcode types supported by the engine

member.summary: GetSupportedBarcodeTypes retrieves the engine's supported barcode types

Number of elements in pargBarcodeTypesBuffer
member.returns: IDRS_SUCCESS if all supported barcode types can be retrieved. Error code otherwise

member.name: M:IDRSNET.IBarcodeEngine.ProcessImage(System.Object,IDRSNET.CImage,IDRSNET.CBarcodeContext,IDRSNET.CBarcodeResultSet)
member.summary: ProcessImage runs barcode recognition on the supplied image The image data is guaranteed to be valid until the function ends. If the engine does not change the input image, then it can safely reference the pixels from the provided image. In case the image needs to be modified, the engine should make a copy of the provided image. The barcode results are expected to be added to argBarcodeResults as individual CBarcodeResult objects.
member.param: Barcode session handle
Input image
Barcode context
Object where all barcode results are expected to be stored.
member.returns: IDRS_SUCCESS if the barcode recognition was executed without any error. Error code otherwise

member.name: T:IDRSNET.IBarcodeEnginePostprocess
member.summary: CBarcodeEnginePostprocess class represents the base class for barcode results post-processing The purpose of barcode results post-processing is to allow modification of barcode results returned by an engine before it is actually mixed with the results obtained from other barcode engines

member.name: T:IDRSNET.IBaseImagePlugin
member.summary: The CBaseImagePlugin class represents the base class for all imaging plugins. \ingroup module_core An image plugin is a class that is able to load and/or save a specific type of image. Each plugin needs to announce it's internal capabilities through CImagePluginCapabilities. Each plugin needs to support all options from the used CImageOptionsXXX class. iDRS SDK will invoke function CanLoadFile whenever a file needs to be loaded. The plugin's responsibility is to detect whether the supplied file can be loaded using it's own code.

member.name: M:IDRSNET.IFontDataProviderCallback.GetFontData(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: GetFontData extracts the font data and writes it to the supplied memory stream The font data is required for PDF document creation. Currently iDRS SDK is able to work only with true type font outlines. The following font tables are required: - glyf - head - hhea - loca - maxp - cvt - prep - hmtx - fpgm
member.param: Font Postscript name
Font family name
Boolean flag indicating that bold modifier is applied to the font
Boolean flag indicating that italic modifier is applied to the font
Stream object when the font data should be written
member.returns: IDRS_TRUE is the font has been found and the expected data has been extracted, IDRS_FALSE otherwise

member.name: T:IDRSNET.ILineReader
member.summary: The CLineReader class is the base class to write line reader classes. \ingroup module_core A line reader object is used to provide image buffers inside iDRS. A common usage for this class is to provide the image raw data for image file format that iDRS SDK is not currently supported or for custom image file formats contains a default implementation for this class that works with memory buffers

member.name: M:IDRSNET.ILineReader.GetLine(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)

The 0 based index of the line to retrieve.
The byte width for the line.

member.name: T:IDRSNET.ILogger
member.summary: The ILogger abstract class describes an interface which can be used by a custom class to provide a global logging system The global logging system can be used to provide to an IDRS SDK integrator information and feedback about meaningfuls event The interface contains information about the level of severity of the events that are going to be logged.

member.name: T:IDRSNET.ILogger.eSeverityLevel
member.summary: The eSeverityLevel defines the severity level of the meaningful events that are logged, to give more information to iDRS SDK integrators about the severity of the received event

member.name: F:IDRSNET.ILogger.eSeverityLevel.SeverityLevelInfo
member.summary: This level describes events that will be logged from iDRS as info messages, giving information to user about the progress and the status of an operation

member.name: F:IDRSNET.ILogger.eSeverityLevel.SeverityLevelWarning
member.summary: This level describes events that will be logged from iDRS as warning messages, giving more information to user when a warning occurs during an operation

member.name: F:IDRSNET.ILogger.eSeverityLevel.SeverityLevelError
member.summary: This level describes events that will be logged from iDRS as error messages, giving more information to user when an error occurs during an operation

member.name: M:IDRSNET.ILogger.OnReceivedMessage(IDRSNET.ILogger.eSeverityLevel,System.String)
member.summary: OnReceivedMessage is a method which will be called on reception of meaningful events to provide information about the status and the type of the event. Function will provide information only to events that occur with a severity level equal or higher than the critical severity level provided by user
member.param: The severity level of the events that will be logged
A message providing more information about the occurred event

member.remarks: method must return NULL.

member.name: T:IDRSNET.IDRS_PROCESS_PHASE

member.name: F:IDRSNET.IDRS_PROCESS_PHASE.IDRS_PROCESS_PHASE_UNK
member.summary: Unknown process phase. It appears that some process phases are considered as "generic" and not clearly identified.

member.summary: The character recognition engine starts its processing.

member.name: F:IDRSNET.IDRS_PROCESS_PHASE.IDRS_PROCESS_PHASE_DRS_SEGMENTATION
member.summary: The character recognition engine performs the OCR segmentation step.

member.name: F:IDRSNET.IDRS_PROCESS_PHASE.IDRS_PROCESS_PHASE_DRS_DECISION
member.summary: The character recognition engine performs the OCR decision step.

member.name: F:IDRSNET.IDRS_PROCESS_PHASE.IDRS_PROCESS_PHASE_DRS_END
member.summary: The character recognition engine completes its processing.

member.name: F:IDRSNET.IDRS_PROCESS_PHASE.IDRS_PROCESS_PHASE_LOADING_IMAGE
member.summary: Image file loading. iDRS is currently reading an image in a stream.

member.name: F:IDRSNET.IDRS_PROCESS_PHASE.IDRS_PROCESS_PHASE_SAVING_IMAGE
member.summary: Image file saving. iDRS is currently saving an image to a stream.

member.name: F:IDRSNET.IDRS_PROCESS_PHASE.IDRS_PROCESS_PHASE_IMAGE_ROTATION
member.summary: Image rotation. iDRS rotates an image.

member.name: F:IDRSNET.IDRS_PROCESS_PHASE.IDRS_PROCESS_PHASE_SKEW_DETECTION
member.summary: Skew detection iDRS computes the skew angle in an image.

member.name: F:IDRSNET.IDRS_PROCESS_PHASE.IDRS_PROCESS_PHASE_BINARIZATION
member.summary: Binarization. iDRS computes a the black and white version of a color/greyscale image.

member.name: T:IDRSNET.IProgress
member.summary: The CProgress class represents the base class for all recognition monitor classes. \ingroup module_core To monitor the progress, the integrator can: - use a iDRS standard progress monitor class - develop a custom progress monitor class. To develop a specific progress monitor class, just write a class inheriting from CProgress and set it in iDRS.

members.member:
BeginPhase is called when beginning a new phase of the process.
The identifier for the phase. for all possible processing phases

EndPhase is called when a phase of the process ends
The identifier for the phase. for all possible processing phases

member.name: M:IDRSNET.IProgress.ReportPercent(System.UInt32)
member.summary: ReportPercent must be overridden to monitor the progress of the current phase.
member.param: the progress value. Each time the function is called, the value is incremented.
member.remarks: The progress maximum value is 100.

member.name: M:IDRSNET.IProgress.GetAbortFlag
member.summary: GetAbortFlag can be overridden so the current process will be stop if it returns IDRS_TRUE.

member.name: T:IDRSNET.IStreamFactory
member.summary: IStreamFactory represents an interface used for output stream creation This interface can be used to create new streams for the output documents. Currently it is used for document split feature Currently the sequence of calls is always CreateStream then CloseStream. However, integrators code should not reply on this assumption. There might be several CreateStream called before CloseStream

member.name: M:IDRSNET.IStreamFactory.CreateStream
member.summary: CreateStream is instantiating a new stream that should be opened for write/read The output stream can be a file stream (CFileStream), a memory stream (CMemoryStream) or a custom defined stream The method is expected to return a pointer to the created stream. The class inheriting IStreamFactory should take the necessary precautions to keep the pointer valid until is called
member.returns: Pointer to the created Stream object

member.name: M:IDRSNET.IStreamFactory.CloseStream(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: CloseStream is closing an output stream This method is called automatically when closing a stream created using
member.param: Stream to close
